plugins.name: Checklist Creator
plugins.description:
Easily create elegant checklists to keep track of your design progress.


What it does

The plugin creates a frame with your tasks and checkpoints organised in a table. It also creates status labels (Todo, in progress, awaiting feedback, done, n-a) as variants of a status component.


How to create a checklist

Tasks

Insert the tasks or pages you need to design separated by commas (Ex: Homepage, About, Contact). You may also use "/" to add a separator line between different groups of tasks. (Ex: Navigation, Footer, / , Homepage, About).


Checkpoints

Insert the deliverables needed for your tasks separated by commas (Ex: Wireframes, Mobile design, Desktop design).


How to use it

While designing, easily update the status labels in Figma ui. Select a label in the table and modify its status in the component properties (right panel).


Reorganise the checklist and labels

Tasks list is a vertical auto layout frame. That makes it very easy to reorder, remove or add new tasks.


Separation lines can also be duplicated and moved vertically to organise tasks in groups.


(Hint : use top and bottom keys to reorder tasks rows and separation lines).


The labels are variants of a component. That makes it possible to add new ones or modify those automatically generated by the plug in.


Developed by

Karim Maaloul creative director at EPIC Agency

accepted.name: Karim Maaloul
accepted.description: Co-founder and Creative Director at EPIC Agency

plugins.name: Unipaste
plugins.description:
Unipaste delivers the easiest way to work with special characters in Figma.


Key features

  • 500+ glyphs
  • Search
  • Favorites
  • List/Grid layout
  • Direct text editing
  • Fully keyboard controllable
  • Available in Figma and FigJam
  • Dark mode support


How to use

  • If you are editing text, the glyphs is inserted at the cursor position or instead of the selected part of the text.
  • Otherwise, the glyph is copied to the clipboard.
  • With the text node selected: The left mouse button inserts a character at the beginning of the text, the right mouse button at the end of the text.


Keyboard controls

  • Arrow down: Enter the list/grid
  • Arrows: Navigate in the list/grid
  • Enter: Paste the selected glyph into design (and close Unipaste plugin)
  • Esc: Close Unipaste plugin


Roadmap

  • Parameter input support ✅
  • FigJam support ✅
  • Keyboard control ✅
  • Searching by HTML entity name ✅
  • Dark mode ✅
  • Anything that comes out of the feedback


Warning

Fonts typically do not contain all unicode characters, so for some exotic characters, the character may not be visible in the text.
plugins.tagline: Tool for inserting symbols/characters/glyphs into your design.

plugins.name: DarkSide
plugins.description:
A tool for easily toggling between Light/Dark theme or any 2 themes, and also for theme creation.


How it works


Video

https://youtu.be/LfTFuMJFAac


Playground

https://www.figma.com/community/file/993838088453586739/DarkSide-Playground


Switch

  1. You need to group your styles. Example: “Light”/“Dark”, “Desktop”/“Mobile”.
  2. If this is your team style file, you need to publish the file and click “Save team styles”, local files ignore this step.
  3. Click the "OmegaEffect" button to complete the theme switch.


Create

  1. Create the node, its name will become the style name.
  2. Select all the nodes that need to be created as styles.
  3. Select the corresponding create button according to the type of create style.


Creators: @CuriosityWen @WashingtonHua

accepted.name: CuriosityWen
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.name: Colorizer
plugins.description:
A plugin to sort colors by their hue color. It will then align them in a grid by 10 columns with a 40px gap. Simply select your objects that you want to sort and then run the plugin.


This plugin uses color-sorter (https://github.com/bartveneman/color-sorter) which sorts colors by hue, then saturation. Black-grey-white colors (colors with 0% saturation) are shifted to the end. Fully transparent colors are placed at the very end.

plugins.name: simplify path
plugins.description:
https://github.com/zserge/figma-simplify-path

A small plugin that simplifies vector paths in Figma.

It can be applied to any vector nodes. The plugin iterates through all segments, renders Bezier curves using De Casteljau's algorithm, then reduces the number of points in the lines using Douglas-Peucker algorithm and converts resulting points into new Bezier curves.

This results in smoother and simpler lines, which can be especially helpful when using Pencil tool.

plugins.name: Dominant Color Toolkit 🎨
plugins.description:
Generate a palette from an image to magically populate your designs.


This plugin provides two core functions:


1. Generate utility palette: extracts the dominant color from an image, suggests high-contrast text colors, and includes additional complementary palette information.

2. Smart populate: takes your selection and intelligently sets layer fills and text colors based on nearby images.


Generating a dominant color palette


1. Select one or more layers in Figma that contain image fills.

1. Run the plugin Menu > Dominant Color Toolkit 🎨 and your palette will be generated.


Note: To prevent overlapping frames from appearing in your designs, align your images 500px apart.


Smart populate


1. Select any frame, component, or instance

2. Menu > Dominant Color Toolkit 🎨

3. Command + Shift + P to re-run


How does Smart Populate work?

- If you selected one or more frames which contain an image, shapes, and text, the plugin will use the first image it finds to automatically fill the shapes with the computed dominant color and set text layers to have a high-contrast fill against that dominant color.

- If you selected an image along with shapes and text layers, the plugin will use the selected image to populate selected shapes with the computed dominant color and set text layers to use the high-contrast fill color.

- If you selected shapes and text, but no image, the plugin will traverse outwards in your frame until it finds an image fill. This image will will then be used to populate the shapes and text with the dominant color and high-contrast text colors.


Note: This plugin supports both image fills and background fills, using the first valid fill it can find. As a result, a frame with a background fill that has children shape and text layers will populate successfully!


Secret options: If you'd like to text layers to the dominant color rather than high-contrast color, simply include the text "dominant" anywhere in the layer name!


This plugin is open source, contributions welcome: https://github.com/brianlovin/figma-dominant-color-toolkit


Credits


color-thief (https://github.com/lokesh/color-thief) for finding dominant colors and generating palettes

plugins.name: Tylify - seamless patterns in seconds
plugins.description:
This plugin integrates Tylify, a web-based pattern-making application, into Figma.


Launch the plugin to load a live pattern preview with your Figma selection. Reposition, resize, rotate and duplicate elements until you have a pattern you're pleased with. Press the Save button to load the seamless pattern back into Figma as an image with tile fill.


Resumability

Creating a seamless pattern is a non-destructive operation. The source elements continue to live in your Figma document and manipulations done to the elements in Tylify will be applied to your Figma nodes.


Conversely, after a pattern is created you can make changes to the source elements in Figma by using the Toggle Tile Visibility option. Relaunch Tylify by pressing Edit to save and apply the changes to your pattern.


This keeps Tylify and Figma in sync and allows you to go back and forth between the two without any friction.

accepted.name: Luca
accepted.description: Building web-based tools that don't suck 🛠️🌐

plugins.name: Substrate for text
plugins.description:
Highlight text by adding the cool substrate with this simple plugin!


⚒ To create a substrate.

1. Select one or more text nodes;

2. Click "Create."


⟳ To update a substrate.

1. Select one or more substrates (or their nodes);

2. Click "Update."


× To remove a substrate.

1. Select one or more substrates;

2. Click "Remove". ⚠ The text node will be saved!


Life hack.

They created a substrate and decided to change the text -> changed the text -> updated the substrate.

I would like to correct a little more -> we enter the text, periodically clicking on Ctrl + Alt + P (runs the last command, that is, the substrate update).


✅ Settings

With the help of "Settings" you can customize the substrates.

1. Color. From several colors random will be chosen.

2. Padding. The space around the line of text.

3. Base letter. The symbol on the basis of which the base of the substrate is built.

4. Corner radius and Smoothing.

accepted.name: Andreslav Kozlov
accepted.description: Digital designer. I love the design, the code and the cock crow in the morning :) Freelancer.

plugins.tagline: Highlight text by adding the cool substrate with this simple plugin!

plugins.name: Spotify to Figma
plugins.description:
This simple plugin allows you to get data from Spotify onto your canvas. 


How to use

  1. Call a Spotify API endpoint with desired parameters. You can make it right in your browser via Spotify Developer Console.
  2. Copy the response (make sure it contains an array of playlists, albums, tracks, artists or categories) and paste it into the plugin.
  3. Press the button and wait for a little. Getting covers takes some time. Done!


Example

  1. Let's pretend your project needs some playlists. You go to the Featured Playlists endpoint and fill in the needed options.
  2. Then you have to get a token. Spotify will ask you to authorize. Simply, just press green buttons, and it's done.
  3. Press "Try it", then select and copy the API response from the right side.
  4. Now open the plugin and just paste it. Press "Get data" and there you go!


Good to know

If you close the plugin while it's working, it will stop without filling in the remaining data. When the job is done, the plugin will close automatically.


This plugin was designed to work with arrays of data (several albums, playlist tracks), so it may behave unpredictably with some endpoints like "Get an Album".


Roadmap

This plugin was created for specific needs and its development is dependent on the demand. 

Please, suggest the needed features. I guess the next steps could be:

  • Going to GitHub as an open-source project ✔
  • Expanding the list of supported endpoints
  • Way to customize receiving data
  • Way to call endpoints right from the plugin


If you're interested in this plugin and want to make it better (features, refactoring), contact me.


Problem? Idea? Kind words?

You can contact me via e-mail at nick.denq@gmail.com.

But the most rapid way is Telegram.

This project is open sourced on Github.


Don't hesitate, I'd like to know your thoughts on this plugin (or we can talk about anything else).


<3

accepted.name: Nick Qurle
accepted.description:
freestyle ux/ui designer who knows how code works

doing stuff at figma.com/@vk

plugins.name: Spirous
plugins.description:
To make working with spirographs fun again and usable in UI designs, we at Zeta built Spirous which can mathematically generate beautiful vectors with desired shape, color, stroke width and insert them on the Figma artboard.


Here's what the plugin offers you: 


  • Hand-picked templates to try out
  • Customise spirograph based on color, stroke width and other config options
  • Insert spirograph directly in the art board by clicking anywhere on the preview panel
  • Create and save custom spirographs
  • Feature to randomise spirograph config for generating new patterns


First-time plugin usage:


  • Run the Spirous plugin
  • Choose from hand-picked templates
  • Select the template you like
  • Insert selected template by clicking anywhere on preview panel
  • That's it!! Now use the beautiful Spirograph in your designs

plugins.name: Rasterizio - Help tool
plugins.description:
Convert to image all or any selected elements with a high resolution (2x, 3x, 4x, 8x). The function working around a limitation in Figma where layers can only be rasterized at 1x resolution.


The plugin will help you to convert into image:

  1. Any selected element
  2. Any selected page, no matter how many elements it contains
  3. Any selected file, no matter how many pages it contains


The plugin will help you to manage styles:

  1. Extract - create a list of all Local styles in this Figma file, including colors and text styles.
  2. Generate - to attach the Local styles from a extracted by rasterizio list before.
  3. Remove - select any element such as a frame, selection, component, auto layout, line, ellipse, rectangle and detach all styles which it and any element inside have instantly.
  4. Transfer Out - instantly transfer(copy) all file local styles to another file.
  5. Mass create or update local Text Styles based on formatting of regular text layers.

How it works?

https://youtu.be/Fs5rBUwSjc0


The team Stas Lavrik Design are happy to hear any feedback from the community in comments. Thank you for attention!

plugins.name: Component Variables
plugins.description:
A plugin that helps customize Figma components in an orderly and automatic manner.

Create and edit preset variables within your component without the hassle of going through groups and autolayouts.

__________________

HOW TO USE

• TEXT VARIABLES
Assign a variable name to a text layer and change the text content through the panel.

Name the text layer wrapping it in curly brackets. The name inside will be assigned to the variable. 

E.g.: {label} will create a variable `label`.

• SELECTOR VARIABLES
Create grouped options which only one is shown at a time.

Wrap the layer name in brackets, the first name should be the group name and the second the variable name. Separate the names with a '.' .

When selected, all layers will be hidden, expect the chosen one.

E.g.: [Color.Blue], [Color.Green] creates a group 'Color' in which you can choose between 'Blue' and 'Green' colors.

• CONDITION VARIABLES
Show or hide a layer based on a condition.

Name the layer wrapping it in parenthesis. This will create a toggle for the variable name which you can show/hide on the panel. 

E.g.: (disabled)

You can create an inverse condition by naming the layer starting with a '!' .

E.g.: (!disabled)

__________________

NOTES

• The variables should be created on the master component, keeping in mind not to rename the layers on the instance.

• The configuration panel works only with instances.

• You can create multiple layers with the same name to get the same behaviour on them.

plugins.name: Frame Renamer
plugins.description:
Frame Renamer is a Figma plugin that automates the process of renaming frames, components, slices, and sections. It does this based on the content of a specified text layer within those frames, such as a headline or title, making it easier to manage and organize your Figma projects.


How to Use


  1. Specify Text Layer: Input the name of the text layer that you want to use as the source for renaming frames. By default, the text layer name is set to "Headline."
  2. Select Frames: You have the option to manually select the frames you want to rename. If no frames are selected, the plugin will rename all frames on the current Figma page.
  3. (optional) Rename Child Layers: Use the checkbox to decide whether you want to rename child layers within the selected frames or components. This is particularly useful for maintaining a consistent naming convention throughout nested elements.
  4. Toggle & Rename: Use the toggle switch to choose between renaming all frames or just the selected ones. Once you've made your choice, click the "Rename" button to execute.
  5. Review: After the renaming process is complete, review the frames to ensure they meet your requirements.


Core Features


  • Text Layer Specification: Select a specific text layer to serve as the basis for renaming.
  • Selective Renaming: Choose to rename either all frames on the current page or only those you've selected.
  • Batch Renaming: The ability to rename multiple frames at once, based on the content of the specified text layer.
  • Child Layer Renaming: Option to rename child layers within the selected frames or components, providing a comprehensive renaming solution.


Key Benefits


  • Efficiency: Save time and effort by streamlining the process of organizing and managing frames.
  • Flexibility: With multiple renaming options, including child layer renaming, you can tailor the plugin to suit your specific needs.
  • Clarity: Maintain a cleaner, more organized project by automating frame and child layer naming.
  • User-Friendly: The plugin features an intuitive user interface with straightforward options, making it accessible for users of all skill levels.

accepted.name: Sascha Wohlgemuth
accepted.description: UX Designer @ Hoffmann Group

plugins.tagline: This plugin renames frames based on a specified text layer, offering all/selected frame options.

plugins.name: Node››frame
plugins.description:
Transform any Figma element into frames, components, and more - with properties preserved!


Tired of recreating elements because you need a different node type? This plugin lets you convert between various Figma elements whilst preserving their styling, position, and hierarchy.


Key Features:

  1. Convert shapes (rectangles, ellipses, vectors) to frames or components
  2. Transform instances into components whilst maintaining their properties
  3. Convert text layers into frames (with options to preserve text structure)
  4. Turn vectors into frames (with options to convert points to shapes)
  5. Convert frames to grid layouts with customisable options
  6. Transform groups into frames (with recursive option for nested groups)
  7. Convert components/instances to frames, groups, or shapes
  8. Apply auto-layout during conversion with customisable settings


All conversions preserve:

  1. Visual properties (size, position, fills, strokes, effects)
  2. Component properties
  3. Child hierarchy and positioning
  4. Blend modes and opacity


Available Commands:

  1. Shape to Frame / Auto-Layout Frame / Component
  2. Instance to Component
  3. Frame to Grid / Shape / Component
  4. Group to Frame (with recursive option)
  5. Text to Frame
  6. Vector to Frame
  7. Component to Frame / Group / Shape


Works with multiple selections - convert multiple elements at once!


Note: All conversions maintain the exact visual appearance and position of your elements, ensuring your designs stay pixel-perfect through the conversion process.

accepted.name: Karl Koch
accepted.description: Currently building DuckDuckGo, Cosmic, Hand››over, and plugins.run.

plugins.tagline: Transform Figma elements into frames and components, preserving all properties.

plugins.name: Interactive Input Fields
plugins.description:
Description

Interactive Input Fields is a powerful Figma plugin developed to enhance your prototypes by adding interactive input fields directly within Figma. This plugin allows you to create fully functional input fields, enabling more realistic and interactive prototypes and user testing without needing to export your designs to other tools. Save time and effort by keeping everything natively within Figma!



Features and Advantages

  1. Time-Saving: No need for exporting your screens to other tools; everything is done natively within Figma.
  2. User-Friendly: The easy to use and intuitive GUI makes it effortless to create and customize your input fields.
  3. Customization: You can base your input fields on components, to easily change the style of multiple without having to modify every field on it's own.
  4. Mobile Keyboard: Additionally to the normal keyboard support, you can create a fully functional mobile keyboard (QWERTZ and QWERTY) for mobile screens.
  5. Removable Characters: Pressing the back/delete key allows you to remove the last three characters individually; beyond that, the entire input will be cleared.
  6. Versatile Placement: Input fields can be placed in any frame and subframe, including Auto-Layout frames.
  7. Precision and Passion: Built with a focus on detail, performance, and user experience. This plugin is incredibly fast and reliable, showcasing the dedication behind its development. If any issues arise, I am committed to finding a solution quickly.
  8. And yes, there's more: an animated cursor, dynamic placeholders, TABulator integration and a focus state, which can be customized.
  9. Last but not least: Basically this all isn't even easily possible within Figma, but I love pushing the boundaries and making things work. So here it is – I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!



How to Use

  1. Base on Component: If you want to easily update the style of your input fields later on, enable the function "Base input fields on a component"
  2. Appearance: Now you can specify the width and font style & size as well as showing the labels or not. You can modify all of this later in the component or directly in the input field as well.
  3. Keyboard Layout: For the moment you can choose between the QWERTY and QWERTZ keyboard layouts, which will reflect to the normal keyboard and the mobile keyboard layout. This setting applies to the frame you have selected. If you later want to change the keyboard layout, you can do so by adding another input field to this frame with the other keyboard layout. All existing input fields will then be updated.
  4. Add Input Fields: You can add multiple input fields simultaneously, but only within a single frame at a time. Please note that creating many fields may increase execution time.
  5. Name/Label: This will define the names of the input variables as well as the name of the input field. You can change the name/label later anytime within Figma.
  6. Type: For all kinds of text inputs (also numbers like city code), please always use "Text". "Numbers" should be only used if you have to calculate with the variable later in your prototype, for example for amounts. The type Numbers also has an input limitation of roughly 900.000.000 and the variable must be manually connected, due to a missing Figma API feature.
  7. Placeholder: You can enable placeholders individually for each field. The placeholder text can be set after the creation of the input field(s).



Test Phase

During the test phase you can create up to 3 times as many input fields as you need, to explore the plugin's capabilities.



Do's and Don'ts

Do's:

  1. Change colors and styles for the default and focus state within the component or input field, to fit your design.
  2. Place input fields in any frame, even deeply nested and Auto-Layout ones.

Don'ts:

  1. Don't add or modify layers within the input component.

Current limitations:

  1. You can't move input fields between main frames. Instead, delete and recreate them.
  2. Don't merge multiple frames containing input fields into a new frame.



--------

--------



Last words:

This plugin was built with lots of passion. It reflects the commitment to creating tools that enhance the design and development experience inside Figma. I am very happy that it is finally live on the community!


Try it now and explore the possibilities of interactive prototypes directly within Figma with my plugin!
plugins.tagline: Easily create highly interactive & custom input fields for your prototypes – directly in Figma.

97035.name: Interactive Input Fields
97035.description:
Description

Interactive Input Fields is a powerful Figma plugin developed to enhance your prototypes by adding interactive input fields directly within Figma. This plugin allows you to create fully functional input fields, enabling more realistic and interactive prototypes and user testing without needing to export your designs to other tools. Save time and effort by keeping everything natively within Figma!



Features and Advantages

  1. Time-Saving: No need for exporting your screens to other tools; everything is done natively within Figma.
  2. User-Friendly: The easy to use and intuitive GUI makes it effortless to create and customize your input fields.
  3. Customization: You can base your input fields on components, to easily change the style of multiple without having to modify every field on it's own.
  4. Mobile Keyboard: Additionally to the normal keyboard support, you can create a fully functional mobile keyboard (QWERTZ and QWERTY) for mobile screens.
  5. Removable Characters: Pressing the back/delete key allows you to remove the last three characters individually; beyond that, the entire input will be cleared.
  6. Versatile Placement: Input fields can be placed in any frame and subframe, including Auto-Layout frames.
  7. Precision and Passion: Built with a focus on detail, performance, and user experience. This plugin is incredibly fast and reliable, showcasing the dedication behind its development. If any issues arise, I am committed to finding a solution quickly.
  8. And yes, there's more: an animated cursor, dynamic placeholders, TABulator integration and a focus state, which can be customized.
  9. Last but not least: Basically this all isn't even easily possible within Figma, but I love pushing the boundaries and making things work. So here it is – I hope you enjoy it as much as I do!



How to Use

  1. Base on Component: If you want to easily update the style of your input fields later on, enable the function "Base input fields on a component"
  2. Appearance: Now you can specify the width and font style & size as well as showing the labels or not. You can modify all of this later in the component or directly in the input field as well.
  3. Keyboard Layout: For the moment you can choose between the QWERTY and QWERTZ keyboard layouts, which will reflect to the normal keyboard and the mobile keyboard layout. This setting applies to the frame you have selected. If you later want to change the keyboard layout, you can do so by adding another input field to this frame with the other keyboard layout. All existing input fields will then be updated.
  4. Add Input Fields: You can add multiple input fields simultaneously, but only within a single frame at a time. Please note that creating many fields may increase execution time.
  5. Name/Label: This will define the names of the input variables as well as the name of the input field. You can change the name/label later anytime within Figma.
  6. Type: For all kinds of text inputs (also numbers like city code), please always use "Text". "Numbers" should be only used if you have to calculate with the variable later in your prototype, for example for amounts. The type Numbers also has an input limitation of roughly 900.000.000 and the variable must be manually connected, due to a missing Figma API feature.
  7. Placeholder: You can enable placeholders individually for each field. The placeholder text can be set after the creation of the input field(s).



Test Phase

During the test phase you can create up to 3 times as many input fields as you need, to explore the plugin's capabilities.



Do's and Don'ts

Do's:

  1. Change colors and styles for the default and focus state within the component or input field, to fit your design.
  2. Place input fields in any frame, even deeply nested and Auto-Layout ones.

Don'ts:

  1. Don't add or modify layers within the input component.

Current limitations:

  1. You can't move input fields between main frames. Instead, delete and recreate them.
  2. Don't merge multiple frames containing input fields into a new frame.



--------

--------



Last words:

This plugin was built with lots of passion. It reflects the commitment to creating tools that enhance the design and development experience inside Figma. I am very happy that it is finally live on the community!


Try it now and explore the possibilities of interactive prototypes directly within Figma with my plugin!
97035.tagline: Easily create highly interactive & custom input fields for your prototypes – directly in Figma.

plugins.name: UI flows for Figma
plugins.description:
What it is:

Easily create screen transition diagrams with text.

Screen transition diagrams can also be converted to text.


It's based on the "A shorthand for designing UI flows" technique as published by Ryan Singer. Reading this 5 minute read is highly recommended.


How to use:

(1) Below is a simple example. Paste it into the text area of the plugin and press the Create UI flows button.


[Login]
Username input field
Password input field
--
Login
Forgot password

[Forgot password]
e-mail input field
--
Submit


(2) Use arrows to connect screens as needed.

In addition, you can change characters and edit instances directly from Figma.


Use your favorite plugins for the arrows.

Recommended: Simpleflow


(3) If you want to change the contents of the Figma to text(UI flows markdown format), select some frames and press the Export markdown button to copy it to the clipboard.

This function is useful when you want to put the information on other tools.


Acknowledgements:

We would like to take this opportunity to thank.

Ryan Singer, creator of the UI flows method.

@hirokidaichi, creator of the UI flows markdown format.

@k1rn for sharing ideas on how to create a UI flow with Figma.
plugins.tagline: Easily create screen transition diagrams with text.

plugins.name: Curvature
plugins.description:
Draws the curvature of your vectors.


Ever wondered why the connections of your Bezier Curves don't feel smooth?

Joining Bezier curves was never easier: This tool helps you design seamless vector graphics with no sharp edges. Your Bezier curves will feel perfectly smooth.


HowTo

Select or draw a vector with the pen tool. Click and drag to draw Bezier curves. While this plugin is activated, the Bezier curves' curvature of the selected vector is shown. Adjust the handles of the Bezier curves to smoothen: If the curvature of both Bezier curves is equal, there will be no sharp edges.


Inspired by https://en.99designs.de/blog/engineering/math-draw-vector-curves/

Please reach out to me for any improvements you have in mind.

plugins.name: Scripter
plugins.description:
Speed up your workflow or experiment with the Figma API through scripts. Backed by the same editor infrastructure used by Microsoft VS Code, Scripter provides a fun and safe environment for playing with the Figma plugin API without the need to write actual plugins. Just type and run.


-> Automatically saves scripts on your computer.

-> Ability to save, load and share scripts in Figma files.

-> Guides you through navigating the API with code completion.

-> Immediate feedback of output and errors.

-> Comes with examples and a copy of the Figma plugin API definitions.

-> await/async at the top level.

-> Async timers with timer().

-> Animations with animate().

-> Many convenient functions built-in, like node type guards.


Note: Currently does not work with Safari

plugins.name: Fast Photo Paste
plugins.description:
Search, generate, upload!


This plugin will help you find and add photos to your project with just one click from popular free stock photo websites.


It's all free!


The photos in the search results also come with a free commercial license. You can check the license details for each photo in the plugin by clicking on the source link below each photo.


AI Generation Features:


Currently, you can generate a user profile portrait using neural networks. We are also actively working on further developments in this area, so stay tuned for new updates.


The plugin is easy to use:


  1. Select an image.
  2. Choose a search engine.
  3. Click on the desired photo or click and hold to select multiple photos.
  4. Click on it, and the photo will automatically be added to your project.
  5. Alternatively, generate a random photo with one click using the category above.


You can support our ongoing development efforts.


If you have any suggestions or questions, please write to us by email or on Telegram.

plugins.name: Figma to Code on Replit (React, HTML, CSS)
plugins.description:
Design in Figma, Prototype in Replit with AI

This experimental plugin turns static designs into responsive React components. Export the generated code to Replit to share an instantly-deployable React app with your team, for rapid prototyping with real logic and data.


Got feedback? We'd love to hear from you


How it works:

  1. Design a component or page. Use best practices for layer naming, auto-layout and wrapping, and shared styles, to prepare your design for export.
  2. Run this plugin. You can run it in Design Mode or Dev Mode.
  3. Select a layer and click "Generate code". This will generate a React component and CSS module for your selection, along with some basic React template files.
  4. Copy code or create a Repl. You can select a file to copy its contents to your clipboard, or generate a working React Repl by exporting to Replit. Select the Node.js template when asked to choose.
  5. Prototype or polish. Wire the generated code up to real data for user testing or rapid prototyping, or polish the output for use in production.
  6. Deploy and share. Deploy your new Repl to get a shareable URL to your component or page.


Additional features:

  1. Export vector layers as React SVG components (optional)
  2. Automatically infers responsive properties even without autolayout
  3. Choose between exporting CSS modules or inline styles
  4. Generate Google Fonts CSS import statements
  5. Export Figma Node IDs as HTML Attributes and CSS comments (optional) to tie your code back to Figma


What isn't supported?

Currently a few Figma features are unsupported in code generation:

  1. Semantic HTML tags (everything is a div, span, or svg)
  2. Image fills and images will not be exported
  3. Syncing generated code into an existing project/Repl
  4. Gradients and shadows
  5. Variables
  6. Variants
  7. Hidden layers (they will be ignored)


Pro tips:

When you're ready to export, make sure you are following these best practices to generate the most accurate export:

  1. Apply auto-layout, including wrapping, spacing, and constraints, to all layers.
  2. Convert groups to frames. Groups will be exported as SVGs.
  3. Flatten vector layers or create a single group with all the parts and no nested groups
  4. Name your layers something that will be meaningful to a developer, for example a component name (IconButton) or a semantic class (button)
  5. Minimize the number of nested frames as much as possible, so your layout is controlled by as few frames as possible


Caveats and future plans:

  1. The plugin currently attempts to infer auto-layout properties even when they are not specified for a layer. This isn't always perfect.
  2. The plugin does not support Figma prototype behaviors like links and transitions. Functionality can be added in code via the Replit code editor and Replit AI coding assistant.
  3. Instances are poorly supported and don't always work. It's best to detach all nested instances before exporting.

accepted.name: Replit
accepted.description: Replit is an online IDE where you can build software collaboratively from anywhere in the world, on any device, without spending a second on setup.

plugins.tagline: Design in Figma, Prototype in Replit with AI

plugins.name: Figma To WordPress Block
plugins.description:
Figma plugin to easily convert Figma design into WordPress website. The code generated from this plugin can be directly pasted into WordPress editor (WordPress default Gutenberg editor). Working better for well grouped design.


Supported Blocks:

  1. WordPress default blocks
  2. Spectra Blocks (Ultimate Addons for Gutenberg)
  3. Kadence blocks


Tips:

  1. Use "button" name to convert as button block
  2. Group the image parts in 1 group and lock it to be converted as an image block or image background for a flex block/container
  3. When you encounter a broken layout in the preview, try grouping the broken parts manually before converting it again.

plugins.name: Project Notes
plugins.description:
About

Project Notes helps you keep your project organised with easy to access titles, footnotes and stickies for all your artboards.


Using the Plugin

Select one of the options from the plugin UI and it will automatically be added to your projects canvas.


For the Title and Footnote tools, you can either add them normally to the center of the canvas, or you can attach them to one or multiple frames. To do this, simple select the frames you wish to attach a title and/or footnote too and then click on the relevant option in the plugin UI and the new objects will appear above (title) or below (footnote) each or your selected frames. This is a great way to title and add notes to each of your frames.


For the Annotation and Sticky Note tools, you can just add them anywhere you want on your canvas and add as many as you want. They both use autolayout, so you can just type as much content as you need and the objects will resize vertically. If you need too, you can extend the width of them manually.


New in version 10-12:

  1. Reworked UI to accommodate different sized titles and footnotes.
  2. The plugin no longer requires you to have pre selected elements on the canvas to add titles and footnotes.
  3. I removed the title+footnote objects based on low usage numbers in favour of two individual tools.
  4. Added autolayout to both the annotation and sticky tools.
  5. The sticky notes now include your name in the bottom right.
  6. Added a feedback link and some better logging to help me develop the plugin further.


Feedback

If anyone has feedback on this plugin, please send to hello[at]stugreenham[dot]com 🤙🏼 or use the link in the plugin footer.

accepted.name: Stu Greenham
accepted.description: Design Lead @ Goodnotes • Proud Yorkshireman

plugins.tagline: Keep your projects organised with ease

plugins.name: Import Miro Board
plugins.description:
Import Miro boards into FigJam.


This plugin allows you to connect your Miro account in order to import boards from Miro into FigJam. There is coverage of the most commonly used elements in Miro - text, notes, shapes, frames - but not all cases are covered.


If you have any issues with the conversion (elements not appearing or significantly different from how they appear in Miro, please leave a comment below or reach out on emile@pygma.app and I will try to fix it ASAP).


This is a paid plugin - the first two imports are free, after that you will have to buy credits. Pricing is as follows, one credit = one import from Miro:

  • 10 credits - $20
  • 50 credits - $75
  • 100 credits - $125


How to use:

  1. Create a blank file in FigJam ready to import boards into.
  2. Open the plugin and login with Miro. Your Miro boards will be loaded once you have finished authentication.
  3. Choose a board and click the "Import" button. Make sure that the canvas you are pasting into is empty.


List of Miro items not currently supported:

  • Cards (this will be done soon)
  • Tables (this will be done soon)
  • Kanban, mindmaps (these are not exposed by Miro's API and unlikely to be possible any time soon)


Reach out or leave a comment if one of the unsupported is a higher priority for you and you are a paying customer (or willing to become a paying customer once it is supported).
plugins.tagline: Import boards from Miro into Figjam. Save hours of manual work.

plugins.name: Millimeters
plugins.description:
Figma's internal DPI is 72, and the conversion from millimeters to pixels is just: value × 72 / 25.4. This plugin automates the conversion, allowing you to enter and display measurements in millimeters.


Supported properties

  • Position
  • Size
  • Corner Radius (Individually)
  • Auto Layout Gap (Individually)
  • Auto Layout Padding (Individually)
  • Stroke Weight (Individually)

plugins.name: Real Time Clock
plugins.description:
Configuring layers


Select a date or time format from the list of options. The date/time format can then be added to the page as a new text layer or, with a valid selection, assigned to an existing text layer. All formatted text layers can be modified or updated at any time.


Starting the clock will result in all formatted time and date layers to update in real time, at one second intervals. Stopping the clock or closing the plugin will prevent any further updates.


Prototypes and presentations


Displaying live time and date information in a prototype or presentation requires two instances of your document to be open - a common method is using a combination of the Figma Windows/Mac application and a web browser. One instance is used to control the plugin and update the live time and date information, the other is used to display the prototype or presentation.

accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

accepted.name: Lee Murray
accepted.description: Senior UX Engineer @ Microsoft
